title.native: Wake Up, Girls! 七人のアイドル
title.romaji: Wake Up, Girls! Shichinin no Idol

description:
Green Leaves Entertainment is in the worst situation any Talent Management Agency can be in... they have NO talent! Desperate for an act, President Junko Tange targets the idol singer market and gives her flunky Matsuda his marching orders: get a girl group to manage, even if it means building one from scratch!

Since complete singing groups rarely appear out of thin air, Matsuda's now in the difficult position of having to find girls with the right skills who don't already have contracts with Japan's music industry. That girl at the Maid Café? Good enough! A lead singer who's been fired from another group? Sure, why not? How about one who's only 13 years old? What could possibly go wrong there?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

title.native: Wake Up, Girls!
Wake Up, Girls! 出逢いの記録 ～A Brief Recording～
劇場版 Wake Up,Girls! 七人のアイドル

node.description:
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamacane0901/) | [Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/kanku0901/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcZ_aVrm0ux7Jw2G5jgq6Gw/)

Yutaka Yamamoto is a director, scriprtwriter, lyricist and storyboarder. Infamous for his incendiary behavior on Twitter and for having been fired from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) and [Ordet](https://anilist.co/studio/334/), the latter of which he helped co-found. 

As a member of Kyoto Animation, he rose to prominence within the company after serving as assistant director on [Munto 2: Beyond the Walls of Time](https://anilist.co/anime/1135/). In 2006, he was selected to be the chief episode director of [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/), after which he became well known among anime fans for the ending dance theme he choreographed. He was to make his full directorial debut with [Lucky Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1887/), but was replaced after four episodes due to "performance issues." In a later radio interview, Yamamoto confirmed he was fired by Kyoto Animation and unsuccessfully attempted to win back his job. 

Yamamoto has threatened to quit his career in anime production six times over the years. In May 2019, Yamamoto vowed never to "work on anything related to animation again" after finishing [Hakubo](https://anilist.co/anime/98784/). He has become notorious for his incendiary behavior on Twitter, including calling fans of anime "mentally disabled," discriminatory remarks about Chinese and Korean anime fans, and attacking his former cast members, which resulted in him being temporarily suspended from Twitter in 2018.

name.native: ウェイクアップ ガールズ

node.description:
__[Website](https://wug-portal.jp/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/wakeupgirls/)__

__Formed:__ April 1, 2013

__Wake Up, Girls!__, otherwise known through the abbreviation WUG is a Japanese voice actress (seiyuu) collaboration signed under record label DIVE II Entertainment, which was initially made for the anime franchise [Wake Up, Girls!](https://anilist.co/anime/19023/Wake-Up-Girls/).

__Members:__
- [Mayu Yoshioka](https://anilist.co/staff/118477/Mayu-Yoshioka) (吉岡茉祐) - Member Color: Red
- [Airi Eino](https://anilist.co/staff/118471/Airi-Eino) (永野愛理) - Member Color: Indigo
- [Minami Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/118473/Minami-Tanaka) (田中美海) - Member Color: Yellow
- [Yoshino Aoyama](https://anilist.co/staff/118475/Yoshino-Aoyama) (青山吉能) - Member Color: Turquoise
- [Nanami Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/118472/Nanami-Yamashita) (山下七海) - Member Color: Purple
- [Kaya Okuno](https://anilist.co/staff/118474/Kaya-Okuno) (奥野香耶) - Member Color: Green
- [Miyu Takagi](https://anilist.co/staff/118476/Miyu-Takagi) (高木美佑) - Member Color: Orange

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wake_Up,_Girls!_(%E5%A3%B0%E5%84%AA%E3%83%A6%E3%83%8B%E3%83%83%E3%83%88), edited)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamacane0901/) | [Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/kanku0901/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcZ_aVrm0ux7Jw2G5jgq6Gw/)

In 2006, he was selected to be the chief episode director of [The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/), after which he became well known among anime fans for the ending dance theme he choreographed. He was to make his full directorial debut with [Lucky Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1887/), but was replaced after four episodes due to "performance issues." In a later radio interview, Yamamoto confirmed he was fired by Kyoto Animation and unsuccessfully attempted to win back his job. 

Yamamoto has threatened to quit his career in anime production six times over the years. In May 2019, Yamamoto vowed never to "work on anything related to animation again" after finishing [Hakubo](https://anilist.co/anime/98784/).
